What Students Are Expected to Do: Develop awareness of books and print, recognize some letters, begin to understand that letters represent sounds, listen to and engage with stories, respond to simple questions, and express ideas through pictures and early marks.
Develop print awareness, recognize letters, understand sounds (phonemes), listen to stories, ask and answer basic questions, and express ideas through drawing, dictation, and simple writing.

Read simple texts with increasing accuracy, recognize and decode common words, identify main ideas and basic details, build phonics and fluency, write short sentences and simple opinions, and participate in guided discussions.

Read age-appropriate texts fluently, identify main ideas and supporting details, use phonics knowledge to decode words, write short opinions and narratives with basic structure, and participate in structured discussions.

Read and comprehend longer literary and informational texts, identify key details and quote evidence, determine themes and main ideas, write organized paragraphs, conduct short research projects, and use academic vocabulary.
